citeinfo.title: _Corridor
citeinfo.onlink: \\fs01\CARTOGRAPHY\Projects\CEC\RETI Renewable Interconnections\RETI Phase 2 Working Group\Master Maps 6_8_09\RETI_Base_Files.gdb

descript.abstract: This layer represents areas which have been proposed (per the requirements of Section 368 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005) as West-wide energy corridors for the final "Programmatic Environmental Impact Statement, Designation of Energy Corridors on Federal Land in the 11 Western States", November 2008.
descript.purpose: This layer was created to depict the proposed locations of Section 368 energy corridors on federal lands in the Western 11 states.

idinfo.useconst: These data have been created by UChicago Argonne, LLC, Operator of Argonne National Laboratory ("Argonne"). Argonne, a U.S. Department of Energy Office of Science laboratory, is operated under Contract No. DE-AC02-06CH11357. The U.S. Government retains for itself, and others acting on its behalf, a paid-up nonexclusive, irrevocable worldwide license in said article to reproduce, prepare derivative works, distribute copies to the public, and perform publicly and display publicly, by or on behalf of the Government.

cntorgp.cntorg: Environmental Science Division, Argonne National Laboratory

idinfo.datacred: Produced by Argonne National Laboratory and federal agencies in support of the West-wide Energy Corridors project.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

attracc.attraccr: Polygon attributes are a compliation of many different souces, developed and reviewed with the participating agencies. Some attributes are based on intersection with other GIS data sources and are therefore subject to their accuracy limitations.

dataqual.logic: Polygons have been determined to be topologically correct without overlapping areas, and without gaps along corridor segments.
dataqual.complete: Includes all corridors analyzed in the final Programmatic Environmental Impact Statement.

horizpa.horizpar:
This layer represents a compilation of data from many sources, each with their own scale and quality limitations. It has been analyzed against other GIS layers also having their scale and quality limitations. Significant work has been done to map locations so that protected lands are avoided wherever possible, and to encode the GIS and tabular information provided by the many sources as accurately as possible.
The target maximum scale for the layer during development was 1:24,000. However, protected land boundaries and many other layers necessary to bound the corridor locations are simply not available at 1:24,000 scale or better for the 11-state region. Even the best available surface mangement agency layer used to determine which lands are federal has some content developed from sources with scales less than 1:24,000.

srcinfo.srccontr: This layer is a compilation of many sources from many offices in several federal agencies. Inquiries should be directed to the federal land management agency or agencies with jurisdiction over the lands in the area of interest.

procstep.procdesc: This layer was compiled from many sources, and is based on a set of centerline connections between energy supply and demand areas. Polygons in the layer were made by: 1) Creating a butter around a centerline at a defined width, 2) Integrating polygons received from a project participant, 3) Combining or editing the above to avoid protected lands and to correct topology issues, and/or 4) Truncating or removing areas found to occur on non-federal land.

procstep.srcused: \\fs01\CARTOGRAPHY\Projects\CEC\RETI Renewable Interconnections\RETI Phase 2 Working Group\Master Maps 6_8_09\RETI_Base_Files.gdb

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Corridor name, based on numbered nodes at each endpoint.
Short summary of the mode, designation status, and width.
Indicates whether corridor is currently designated in a Federal Agency land use (or equivalent) plan with a Record of Decision.

edom.edomvd: Corridor is designated in an agency land use plan with a record of decision.
Corridor is not designated in an agency land use plan with a record of decision.

attr.attrdef: Length (perimeter) of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Indicates any restrictions to the compatible energy transport uses of the corridor.

edom.edomvd: No use restriction has been made regarding the energy transport system that could be implemented in the corridor.
Corridor use is limited to electric transmission only.
Corridor use is limited to underground energy transport infrastructure only.
Corridor use is limited to upgrade of existing electrical transmission infrastructure.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Total width of corridor in feet. -1 indicates that the width is variable.
